text: Direct demonstration of <extra_id_0> NFATp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> dephosphorylation and nuclear localization in activated HT-2 cells using a specific <extra_id_0> NFATp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> polyclonal antibody .
Nuclear factor of activated T cells ( NFAT ) regulates transcription of a number of cytokine genes , and NFAT DNA binding activity is stimulated following T cell activation .
Several lines of evidence have suggested that NFAT is a substrate for calcineurin , a serine / threonine phosphatase .

Using a polyclonal antibody to murine <extra_id_0> NFATp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , Western blot analysis of various mouse tissues demonstrated that the 110-130-kDa <extra_id_0> NFATp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein was highly expressed in thymus and spleen .

Treatment of immunoprecipitated <extra_id_0> NFATp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> from untreated HT-2 cells with calcineurin resulted in the dephosphorylation of <extra_id_0> NFATp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , demonstrating that <extra_id_0> NFATp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is an in vitro substrate for calcineurin .
<extra_id_0> NFATp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> immunoprecipitated from 32P-labeled HT-2 cells migrated as an approximately 120-kDa protein that was localized to the cytosol of the cells .

Treatment of the cells with ionomycin resulted in a decrease in the molecular weight of <extra_id_0> NFATp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and a loss of 32P , consistent with <extra_id_0> NFATp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> dephosphorylation .
The dephosphorylation of <extra_id_0> NFATp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was accompanied by localization of the protein to the nuclear fraction .

Both of these events were blocked by preincubation of the cells with FK506 , a calcineurin inhibitor , consistent with the hypothesis that <extra_id_0> NFATp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is a calcineurin substrate in cells .
